strings: # This line is a code comment.
# Comments are lines that start with a #, and they do nothing to the code.
# Instead, they are to leave notes for whoever is writing it.
# Here, you can create your string. Name it whatever you want!
# Down here, you can print it out using the print() function.
# Put your variable name inside the parentheses.
# Its value will be displayed below!
builtins: # Up here, create your variable with input.
# Here, display your variable's contents with print().
ints_and_floats: # Start by making your float up here.
# Name it whatever you want, but make sure that the value is a float!
# Next, use round to turn it into an integer.
# Remember, just writing round(variable_name) will not round it.
# You have to redefine the variable, like variable_name = round(variable_name).
# Down here, display your variable with print.
math: # Start up here by creating a stringified integer.
# Here, add them together and print the result.
# Convert the stringified integer to an integer and the float to a float.
booleans: # Start by making 3 variables. They can be any type you want!
# Next, convert all of them to booleans with bool().
